description: Test the complete task creation workflow including form validation, emoji selection, color picker, deadline setting, and category assignment

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to the URL: https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app/add
Verify that the task creation page loads correctly and displays the form fields
Attempt to submit the form without filling any details to trigger validation errors
Check that appropriate validation messages appear for missing required fields
Enter a task title or description in the designated text input field
Select an emoji using the emoji selection component to represent the task
Choose a color from the color picker component to set the task color
Set the deadline using the deadline picker or date input field provided
Assign a category to the task by selecting from the available dropdown options
Submit the form to create the new task
Verify that the newly created task appears in the task list with all details correctly displayed
Take a screenshot of the completed task creation process to confirm the final outcome

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test the complete task creation workflow including form validation, emoji selection, color picker, deadline setting, and category assignment

description: Test task completion workflow including marking tasks as done, verifying progress bar updates, and checking app badge functionality

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and go to the URL https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app
Identify an incomplete task displayed on the tasks list on the homepage
Mark the identified task as completed by interacting with the checkbox control
Confirm that the task visually appears marked as completed and is updated in the UI
Review the progress bar to ensure it reflects the completed task accurately
Check the application badge to verify that it shows the correct count of remaining tasks
Scroll through the list to confirm that all updated task statuses and progress indicators are clearly visible
Capture a final screenshot of the interface showing completed task, updated progress bar, and accurate badge count

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test task completion workflow including marking tasks as done, verifying progress bar updates, and checking app badge functionality

description: Test task sharing functionality including generating shareable links, QR codes, and verifying the shared task can be imported on another device

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app/
Verify the homepage loads by checking for the visibility of key application elements.
Select an existing task or create a new task to use for testing the sharing functionality.
Access the sharing options by clicking the share icon or button associated with the task.
Generate a shareable link for the selected task by choosing the appropriate option.
Generate a QR code for the task share by selecting the QR code option available.
Copy the shareable link and use it in a new browser session to simulate another device accessing the task.
Verify that the task is successfully imported on the new device by reviewing the displayed task details.
Capture a screenshot of the final task view on the importing device to confirm the test completion.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test task sharing functionality including generating shareable links, QR codes, and verifying the shared task can be imported on another device

description: Test PWA installation process, offline functionality, and app badge features including installation prompt, offline task creation, and badge count updates

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to 'https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app/'
Wait for the PWA installation prompt to appear on the screen
Initiate the installation process by accepting the installation prompt
Verify that the application is successfully installed as a PWA by checking for UI changes such as an app icon or a standalone window view
Simulate offline mode by disabling network connectivity within the browser or using developer tools
Create a new task in the to-do list while offline by entering a task description in the input field and submitting it
Verify that the new task is added to the to-do list even while offline
Check that the application badge count updates to reflect the newly added task
Re-enable network connectivity and observe that the offline task synchronizes correctly if necessary
Take a final screenshot of the application showing the updated badge count and the new task in the list

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test PWA installation process, offline functionality, and app badge features including installation prompt, offline task creation, and badge count updates

description: Test theme switching functionality including light/dark mode toggle, color theme selection, and glow effects to ensure UI updates correctly

steps.stepDescription: Open a web browser and navigate to https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app/
Observe that the default light theme is correctly applied when the page loads.
Locate and activate the dark mode toggle to switch the UI to dark mode.
Verify that the UI elements update their appearance to match the dark theme.
Open the color theme options and choose a different color theme.
Confirm that the selected color theme is accurately reflected across the interface.
Enable the glow effects using the theme settings provided.
Check that glow effects are activated on appropriate UI components as expected.
Capture a screenshot of the final state to validate that theme switching and glow effects work correctly.

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test theme switching functionality including light/dark mode toggle, color theme selection, and glow effects to ensure UI updates correctly

description: Test data import and export functionality including JSON file upload, drag-and-drop import, clipboard import, and export to JSON with validation

steps.stepDescription: Open the web browser and navigate to the transfer page at https://react-cool-todo-app.netlify.app/transfer
Wait for the transfer page to load completely and display the data import/export options
Select the JSON file upload option and choose a valid JSON file to upload for data import
Verify that the imported data from the JSON file upload is displayed correctly on the page
Perform a drag-and-drop action by dragging a JSON file into the designated area for file import
Confirm that the data imported via the drag-and-drop method appears correctly in the application
Copy valid JSON data to the clipboard and trigger the clipboard import functionality in the application
Ensure that the application correctly processes and displays the data imported from the clipboard
Click the export to JSON button to start the process of exporting data from the application
Verify that the exported file contains valid JSON data and matches the expected format of the imported data
Capture a screenshot of the completed data transfer workflow to document the successful test outcome

generatedSteps.stepsSummary: Test data import and export functionality including JSON file upload, drag-and-drop import, clipboard import, and export to JSON with validation
